heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 09 November 2025, dropping 47.89mm of rain over the 144.8 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 47.89mm with a maximum intensity of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 3 cold snaps, with an average of 3.6 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (216°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm) and pressure (down 7 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and near calm conditions. Showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
